intro: Merxmuellera drakensbergensis, commonly known as the Drakensberg mallow, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsules as its fruit. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
